title: About
text:
I am Jack Xu, a thirteen year old who loves birds!
My GitHub account: https://www.github.com/jackxu3
My email: bluebird.jack.xu@gmail.com
My project is about how light pollution affects migratory birds, such as gulls, by reducing rest time and increasing flight speed. The underlying R code of the plots were written by AI tools.
GitHub repository link: https://github.com/jackxu3/bird-light-pollution
This project was created as a part of Kane’s Free Data Science Bootcamp.

title: Analyzing Light Pollution and Bird Migration
text:
Summary
Light pollution affects rest and flight behavior of migratory birds. I gathered data from Kaggle showing three lesser black-backed gulls’ flight paths in 2013 and 2014. The dataset from Globe at Night – Sky Brightness Monitoring Network in 2023 shows light pollution levels. Using this data, we seek to understand the relationship between rest times and flight speeds of birds with light pollution levels. This data shows that more light pollution causes less bird rest times and higher flight speeds, which causes disorientation.

title: Sources
text:
I got the bird migration dataset from Kaggle and the light pollution dataset from Globe at Night.
I cleaned the downloaded data by keeping the Latitude, Longitude, and LimitingMag columns and removing the rest of the columns.
I did not remove rows by changing the dataset itself, but the argument na.rm in the assignation to rest_summary ignores rows containing empty values.
